body.p: Advertising researchers claim that the power of curiosity can be harnessed to design an effective Internet advertising strategy that results in a better evaluation of the advertised product. They develop six advertising texts with varying amounts of "curiosity" triggers. College students are randomly assigned to one of the six versions of the advertisement text and their evaluation score of the advertised product is recorded.
Which of the following is the most appropriate statistical test to use to test if the six versions of the advertisement text differ in their evaluation score?

response.feedback: Incorrect. A matched pairs t-test is used to test the same group of subjects in a before and after situation. Since students are randomly assigned to one of the six versions, there are six independent samples.
Incorrect. A two-sample t-test is used to test mean differences on one quantitative variable for two random samples. Note that we're comparing more than two independent samples.
Correct. ANOVA is used for comparing more than two groups, and therefore can be used to determine if the mean evaluation score is the same for all six advertising texts.
Incorrect. The chi-squared test is used for examining the relationship between two categorical variables. Note that we're comparing more than two groups on a quantitative variable.
Incorrect. Regression is used for examining a relationship between two quantitative variables. We are examining whether evaluation score is related to version, which is a categorical variable.

body.p: We select random samples from several racial/ethnic categories (Caucasian, African American, Hispanic, Asian American) to determine if there is a difference in overall mean earnings among the groups.
Which of the following is the most appropriate statistical test to use to test if their is a difference in overall mean earnings among different racial/ethnic groups?

response.feedback: Incorrect. A matched pairs t-test is used to test the same group of subjects in a before and after situation. Notice that you are testing if there is a difference in means between multiple groups.

Incorrect. A two-sample t-test is used to test mean differences on one quantitative variable for two random samples. Notice that you are testing if there is a difference in means between multiple groups.
Correct. We are comparing the earnings of four racial groups and therefore the ANOVA F-test is appropriate.

Incorrect. A chi-squared test for independence is used to determine if there is an association between two categorical variables. Notice that you are testing if there is a difference in means between multiple groups.

Incorrect. Regression is used for exploring the relationship between two quantitative variables with each variable being measured once for each subject. Notice that you are testing if there is a difference in means between multiple groups.

body.p: Movie executives want to know if a movie watcher’s heart rate increases when they watch certain types of movies. Subjects in the experiment were given a free movie ticket and randomly assigned to watch one of four movies: an action-adventure film, a horror film, a romantic comedy, or an animated children’s film. They measured the average heart rate of all subjects while watching the assigned film.
Which of the following is the most appropriate statistical test to use to test if the average heart rate of the movie watchers was different for the four types of movies?

response.feedback: Incorrect. A matched pairs t-test is used to test the same group of subjects in a before and after situation. Since subjects are randomly assigned to one of the four movie versions, there are four independent samples.
Incorrect. A two-sample t-test is used to test mean differences on one quantitative variable for two random samples. Note that we're comparing more than two independent samples.
Correct. ANOVA is used for comparing more than two groups, and therefore can be used to determine if the mean heart rate is the same for all four movie types.
Incorrect. The chi-squared test is used for examining the relationship between two categorical variables. Note that we're comparing more than two groups on a quantitative variable.
Incorrect. Regression is used for examining a relationship between two quantitative variables. We are examining whether heart rate is related to movie type, which is a categorical variable.
